sentence: But, in the two decades following the abandonment of the gold standard in 1933, the consumer price index in the United States nearly doubled.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: And, in the four decades after that, prices quintupled.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: Monetary policy, unleashed from the constraint of domestic gold convertibility, had allowed a persistent overissuance of money.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: As recently as a decade ago, central bankers, having witnessed more than a half-century of chronic inflation, appeared to confirm that a fiat currency was inherently subject to excess.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: But the adverse consequences of excessive money growth for financial stability and economic performance provoked a backlash.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: The Federal Reserve, under the leadership of Paul Volcker and with the support of both the Carter and the Reagan Administrations, dramatically slowed the growth of money.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: Initially, the economy fell into recession and inflation receded.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: However, most important, when activity staged a vigorous recovery, the progress made in reducing inflation was largely preserved.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: By the end of the 1980s, the inflation climate was being altered dramatically.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: The record of the past twenty years appears to underscore the observation that, although pressures for excess issuance of fiat money are chronic, a prudent monetary policy maintained over a protracted period can contain the forces of inflation.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: With the story of most major economies in the postwar period being the emergence of, and then battle against inflation, concerns about deflation, one of the banes of an earlier century, seldom surfaced.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: The recent experience of Japan has certainly refocused attention on the possibility that an unanticipated fall in the general price level would convert the otherwise relatively manageable level of nominal debt held by households and businesses into a corrosive rising level of real debt and real debt service costs.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: It now appears that we have learned that deflation, as well as inflation, are in the long run monetary phenomena, to extend Milton Friedman's famous dictum.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: To be sure, in the short to medium run, many forces are at play that complicate the link between money and prices.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: These shifts in aggregate supply--whether foreign or domestic in origin--influence the relationship between money and prices.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: Moreover, the tie between money and prices can be altered by dysfunctional financial intermediation, as we have witnessed in Japan.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: The meaning of deflation and the characteristics that differentiate it from the more usual experience of inflation are subjects being actively studied inside and outside of central banks.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: * * * * * Central bankers have long believed that price stability is conducive to achieving maximum sustainable growth.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: Historically, debilitating risk premiums have tended to rise with both expected inflation and deflation, and they have been minimized during conditions of approximate price stability.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: Although the U.S. economy has largely escaped any deflation since World War II, there are some well-founded reasons to presume that deflation is more of a threat to economic growth than is inflation.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: For one, the lower bound on nominal interest rates at zero threatens ever-rising real rates if deflation intensifies.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: A related consequence is that even if debtors are able to refinance loans at zero nominal interest rates, they may still face high and rising real rates that cause their balance sheets to deteriorate.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: If lower price inflation is accompanied by lower average wage inflation, then the prevalence of nominal wages being constrained from falling could increase as price inflation moves toward or below zero.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: In these circumstances, the effective clearing of labor markets would be inhibited, with the consequence being higher rates of unemployment.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: Taken together, these considerations suggest that deflation could well be more damaging than inflation to economic growth.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: In particular, more rapid advances in productivity can make this asymmetry less severe.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: Fast growth of productivity, by buoying expectations of future advances of wages and earnings and thus aggregate demand, enables real interest rates to be higher than would otherwise be the case without restricting economic growth.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: Moreover, to the extent that more-rapid growth of productivity shows through to faster gains in nominal wages, there will be fewer instances in which nominal wages will be pressured to fall.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: One also should not overstate the difficulties posed for monetary policy by the zero bound on interest rates and nominal wage inflexibility even in the absence of faster productivity growth.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: This authority could be used to lower interest rates at longer maturities.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: But if deflation were to develop, options for an aggressive monetary policy response are available.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: * * * * * Certainly, lurking in the background of any evaluation of deflation risks is the concern that those forces could be unleashed by a bursting bubble in asset prices.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: This connection, real or speculative, raises some interesting questions about the most effective approach to the conduct of monetary policy.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: Destabilizing macroeconomic policies and poor economic performance are not likely to provide fertile ground for the optimism that usually accompanies surging asset prices.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: Ironically, low inflation, economic stability, and low risk premiums may provide tinder for asset price speculation that could be sparked should technological innovations open up new opportunities for profitable investment.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: To be sure, the stock prices of old-line companies do rise somewhat through arbitrage when the market as a whole is propelled higher by stock prices of cutting-edge technologies.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: But it is difficult to imagine stock prices of most well-established and seasoned old-line companies surging to wholly unsustainable heights.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: Moreover, skeptics find it too expensive or too risky to short sell the shares of such a company, especially when its stock price is rising rapidly.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: The conditions of extended low inflation and low risk were combined with breakthrough technologies to produce the bubble of recent years.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: Investors are likely to be sensitive to the need for asset prices to be backed ultimately by an ongoing stream of earnings.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: * * * * * Most standard macroeconomic models fitted to the experience of recent decades imply that a distortion in valuation ratios induced by a bubble can be offset by adopting a sufficiently restrictive monetary policy.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: According to such models, a tighter monetary policy, on average, credibly constrains demand and lowers asset prices, all else being equal.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: These models can also be interpreted to suggest that incremental monetary tightening can gradually deflate stock prices.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: As I related this summer at the annual Jackson Hole symposium sponsored by the Kansas City Federal Reserve Bank, "...our experience over the past fifteen years suggests that monetary tightening that deflates stock prices without depressing economic activity has often been associated with subsequent increases in the level of stock prices....Such data suggest that nothing short of a sharp increase in short-term rates that engenders a significant economic retrenchment is sufficient to check a nascent bubble.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: "2 In short, unless a model can be specified to capture the apparent market tendency toward bidding stock prices higher in response to monetary policies aimed at maintaining macroeconomic stability, the accompanying forecasts will belie recent experience.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: "3 The Federal Open Market Committee chose, as you know, to embark on an aggressive course of monetary easing two years ago once it became apparent that a variety of forces, including importantly the slump in household wealth that resulted from the decline in stock prices, were restraining inflation pressures and economic activity.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: The contractionary impulse from the decline in equity prices appeared to be diminishing around the middle of this year.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: But then the fallout for stock prices from corporate governance malfeasance, argued by some as having been spawned by the bubble, became more intense.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: More recently, of course, geopolitical risk has risen markedly, further weighing on demand.
label: LABEL_0

sentence: If the postmortem of recent monetary policy shows that the results of addressing the bubble only after it bursts are unsatisfactory, we would be left with less-appealing choices for the future.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: Thus, it was disturbing to observe risk seemingly being priced so cheaply in late 1997 when BBB corporate spreads over ten-year Treasuries sunk to only 70 basis points.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: * * * * * Weaving a monetary policy path through the thickets of bubbles and deflations and their possible aftermath is not something with which modern central bankers have had much experience.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: As I noted earlier, it seems ironic that a monetary policy that is successful in inducing stability may inadvertently be sowing the seeds of instability associated with asset bubbles.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: I trust that the use by the central bank of deliberately inflationary policy as protection against bubbles can be readily dismissed.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: While the current episode has not yet concluded, it appears that, responding vigorously in a relatively flexible economy to the aftermath of bubbles, as traumatic as that may be, is less inhibiting to long-term growth than chronic high-inflation monetary policy.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: Moderate inflation might possibly inhibit bubbles, though at some cost of reduced economic efficiency.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: The list is rather impressive: First, a halving of stock prices and household equity wealth; second, a dramatic decline in capital expenditures; third, the tragic events of September 11; fourth, the disturbing evidence of corporate malfeasance; and fifth, the recent escalation of geopolitical risks.

sentence: The recovery, however, ran into resistance in the summer, apparently as a consequence of a renewed weakening in equity prices, further revelations of corporate malfeasance, and then the heightened geopolitical risks.

sentence: Although our most probable forecast already was that growth would pick up, we judged the cost of the insurance provided by additional easing as exceptionally modest because we viewed the risk of an imminent rise in inflation as remote.

sentence: Oil prices have recently risen and, not least, the economies of most of our major trading partners have shown little vigor.
